content:
The Ukrainian Folk Festival 2023 will be held at the Ukrainian American Sport Center – Tryzub (www.tryzub.org), County Line and Lower State Roads in Horsham, PA. on Sunday, August 27 from 12:00 – 8:00pm

Exciting, spectacular, dazzling, breathtaking, exhilarating, spirited, soulful, enchanting, captivating, and intriguing – modest words which describe but by no means capture the essence of Ukrainian folk art, music, and dance.  

From the rich color and deep symbolism of the delicate “pysanka” (Ukrainian Easter Egg) to the thunderous, power, rhythm and strength of “HOPAK” – the world’s most exciting ethnic dance, and every brilliant “Kolomiyka” (polka) and soulful folk song in between, experience Ukrainian Folk Festival 2023, celebrating the 32nd anniversary of our ancestral homeland’s independence. 

Enjoy an outdoor summer stage concert and show (1:30 to 4:30pm), live orchestra music (5:00 – 8:00pm), traditional Ukrainian foods and baked goods, BBQ pit, standard picnic fare, vendors’ grove, Ukrainian arts and crafts displays and bazaar, cool refreshments,  Living Exhibitors of  Ukrainian History and Ukrainian hospitality.

A Celebration Liberty, Bravery And Unity

A Resplendent Outdoor Summer Concert (1:30 to 4:30 pm) Marking Ukraine’s Independence, the Unity of her People, Their Gallant Struggle for Freedom, Prosperity & Dignity. 

12:00pm – Music, & Open Rehearsals 

Food, Concessions, Arts and Crafts Market, Displays & Vendors Grove Open

1:30pm – Opening Ceremonies 

1:45pm to 4:30pm Outdoor Summer Concert in the Park  

4:30pm to 8:00pm – Live Music by Vox Ethnika Orchestra (Ukrainian, Traditional, Contemporary, Rock, Ballroom)

The artists (dance troupes, musicians, singers and ensembles that have performed previously) have created a dynamic and integrated collaborative program that will excite the senses.

Featured Performers

Ukrainian Superstar Pop Singer-Songwriter, Iryna Lonchyna

Voloshky Ukrainian Dance Ensemble

Carpathia Folk Dance Ensemble

Efsane Crimean Tatar Ensemble

Singer Yuliya Stupen

Violinist Innesa Tymochko Dekajlo

Ferko Mummers String Band

Ariana Lem Joy Trio

Vox Ethnika Band

Admission (Open to General Public – At gate only): $15 ($2 of each pad admission will be donated to Humanitarian Relief of Victims of War in Ukraine); Children 14 & under – Free; Free Parking; Info: 267.664.3857, info@tryzub.org, or www.tryzub.org.
